Description: SSmall bowl of Nile silt pottery, with flat base and flaring sides, coated with red slip and lightly burnished; the interior bears the remains of white-painted geometric decoration consisting of three chevrons depending from the rim to a circle around the tondo. There are traces of a white line around the rim tip. The paint has worn away leaving mainly ghost impressions of the design.
Condition: fair (rim chipped in a number of places)
